function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Measurement of negative emotions related to COVID-19 on a 7-point Likert scale could lead to underreporting or misinterpretation of emotional impact.","Impact":"Underreporting of negative emotions may hinder the understanding of the true psychological toll of the pandemic, leading to inadequate support and intervention.","Mitigation":"Include open-ended qualitative assessments in addition to Likert scale ratings to capture a wider range of emotional experiences.","Technologies":"Text analysis tools for sentiment and emotion analysis can supplement Likert scale data to provide a more comprehensive view of emotional impact.","People":"Participants in the study, especially those experiencing negative emotions related to COVID-19.","Owner":"Researchers or survey designers conducting the study."},{"Description":"Perceived certainty of punishment for violating COVID-19 measures may influence compliance behavior and risk perception.","Impact":"Overestimation of certainty may lead to unnecessary fear and anxiety, while underestimation may result in non-compliance and increased transmission of the virus.","Mitigation":"Provide clear and consistent communication about the enforcement and consequences of violating COVID-19 measures to align perceptions with actual consequences.","Technologies":"Communication platforms (e.g., public health websites, social media) for disseminating information and updates on COVID-19 measures.","People":"Individuals subject to or affected by COVID-19 measures, as well as the general public.","Owner":"Public health authorities, government agencies, and community leaders responsible for communicating and enforcing COVID-19 measures."},{"Description":"Measurement of capacity to comply with COVID-19 measures involves subjective assessments that may not accurately reflect actual behavior and adherence.","Impact":"Inaccurate assessments of capacity to comply could lead to misinformed decision-making and ineffective allocation of resources for public health interventions.","Mitigation":"Supplement self-reported measures with objective indicators of compliance (e.g., mobility data, observational studies) to validate the reported capacity to comply.","Technologies":"GPS tracking, mobile app data, and other digital tools for monitoring and analyzing population movement and adherence to COVID-19 measures.","People":"Individuals responsible for designing and implementing public health interventions based on assessments of compliance.","Owner":"Public health agencies, government organizations, and research institutions conducting capacity assessments."}]}
